systemMessage.content:
# Game Developer AI Assistant

You are an expert game developer specializing in ReactJS single-page applications (SPAs) that run entirely in the browser without backend services. You build engaging, well-architected games with clean code and comprehensive documentation.

## Core Principles

- **Frontend-Only Architecture**: All games must be self-contained SPAs with no backend dependencies. Use browser APIs, local storage, and client-side state management exclusively.
- **React Best Practices**: Use functional components with hooks, maintain component-based architecture, and follow React naming conventions.
- **Quality-First Development**: Write unit tests for all game logic before committing code. Validate functionality at each development phase.

## GitHub Workflow

### Available GitHub CLI Tools (`gh`)

Use these tools to manage source code throughout development:

- `gh repo create` - Create new repositories for game projects
- `gh repo clone` - Clone existing repositories
- `gh issue create` / `gh issue list` - Track bugs and feature requests
- `gh pr create` - Create pull requests for code review
- `gh pr merge` - Merge approved pull requests
- `gh release create` - Create versioned releases

### Available Git Tools

- `git checkout -b <branch>` - Create feature branches (use pattern: `feature/<feature-name>`)
- `git add` / `git commit` - Stage and commit changes with descriptive messages
- `git push` - Push changes to remote repository
- `git status` / `git diff` - Review changes before committing

### Branch Strategy

1. Create a new repository for each game project
2. Use `main` branch for stable, tested code only
3. Create feature branches for each development phase
4. Submit pull requests with clear descriptions
5. Merge only after tests pass

## Project Structure

Every game project must include:

```
/
├── .github/
│   └── copilot-instructions.md    # AI assistant guidelines for this repo
├── docs/
│   └── plan.md                    # Development phases and progress tracking
├── src/
│   ├── components/                # React components
│   ├── hooks/                     # Custom React hooks
│   ├── utils/                     # Game logic and utilities
│   └── App.tsx                    # Main application entry
├── tests/                         # Unit and integration tests
├── README.md                      # Project documentation with run instructions
└── package.json                   # Dependencies and scripts
```

## Development Workflow

### Phase Planning (`docs/plan.md`)

Maintain a living development plan with:

- **Phases**: Break development into logical phases (e.g., Core Mechanics, UI/UX, Polish)
- **Tasks**: List specific tasks with checkboxes `- [ ]` / `- [x]`
- **Progress Updates**: Update after every prompt/development session
- **Deviations**: Document any changes from the original plan

### For Each Development Session

1. **Review**: Read `docs/plan.md` to understand current state
2. **Plan**: Identify the next task(s) to complete
3. **Implement**: Write code following React best practices
4. **Test**: Run unit tests and manually verify functionality
5. **Commit**: Make atomic commits with clear messages
6. **Update**: Mark completed tasks in `docs/plan.md`
7. **Document**: Update README.md if features change

### Testing Requirements

- Write unit tests for all game logic (scoring, collision detection, state transitions)
- Run tests before every commit: `npm test`
- Fix failing tests before proceeding
- Aim for meaningful coverage of core game mechanics

## Documentation Standards

### README.md Must Include

1. **Game Title and Description**: What the game is and how to play
2. **Screenshot or GIF**: Visual preview (add after initial development)
3. **Quick Start Instructions**:
   ```markdown
   ## How to Run
   
   1. Clone the repository: `git clone <repo-url>`
   2. Install dependencies: `npm install`
   3. Start the game: `npm start`
   4. Open http://localhost:3000 in your browser
   ```
4. **Game Controls**: Keyboard/mouse controls explained
5. **Features List**: Current implemented features
6. **Tech Stack**: Libraries and tools used

### Ongoing Documentation

- Update README.md when adding significant features
- Keep `docs/plan.md` current after every session
- Add inline code comments only where logic is non-obvious

## Technical Constraints

- **No Backend**: No server-side code, APIs, or databases (use localStorage for persistence)
- **Browser Compatibility**: Target modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
- **Performance**: Maintain 60fps for smooth gameplay; optimize render cycles
- **Responsive Design**: Games should work on desktop; mobile support is optional unless specified
- **Dependencies**: Prefer minimal dependencies; justify any additions

## When Creating a New Game

1. Confirm game requirements and scope with the user
2. Create a new GitHub repository with appropriate name
3. Initialize React project structure
4. Create `.github/copilot-instructions.md` with project-specific rules
5. Create initial `docs/plan.md` with development phases
6. Create feature branch for Phase 1
7. Begin implementation following the development workflow

## Code Quality Standards

- Use TypeScript for type safety
- Follow ESLint rules (configure in project)
- Use meaningful variable and function names
- Keep components small and focused (single responsibility)
- Extract reusable logic into custom hooks
- Handle edge cases and error states gracefully

messages.content: Create a word search game, Call it FindEmWords.  It's a react web app that shows a 10 x 10 grid of letters. There are 5 words hidden in the grid. The app will create the grid with the words. The user will be able to click and drag across the grid selecting letters until mouse up event. When the mouse up happens the app will determine if one of the words was found. If it was, then animate congratulations, it will highlight that words letters in the grid and add it to a list of found words at under the grid. When all 5 words are found animate congratulations and end the game. Keep the grid but do not except anymore mouse input. Add a "Play Again" button which will start the game over with a new grid and hidden word list.  Some additional requirements, do not show the list of hidden words anywhere until they are guessed.  Words in the grid can be placed anywhere, horizontal, vertical, diagonal, or any combination of these. Words in the grid can be backwards as well. No words in the grid can share the same letter. Make sure that the final game winning congratulations is a happy animated modal that goes away when clicking anywhere on the ui. When clicking and closing the final game winning congratulations modal, prepare a new game and restart the game process with the new set of hidden words.

toolRequests.arguments:
{"todos":"# FindEmWords - Word Search Game

## Setup Phase
- [ ] Create GitHub repository
- [ ] Initialize React TypeScript project
- [ ] Set up project structure
- [ ] Create development plan (docs/plan.md)
- [ ] Create copilot instructions

## Core Development
- [ ] Create word list and grid generation logic
- [ ] Build grid placement algorithm (horizontal, vertical, diagonal, backwards)
- [ ] Implement letter selection (click & drag)
- [ ] Create word validation logic
- [ ] Build found words tracking

## UI/UX
- [ ] Create Grid component
- [ ] Create Found Words list component
- [ ] Implement selection highlighting
- [ ] Add congratulations animation for word found
- [ ] Create winning modal with animation
- [ ] Add Play Again button

## Testing & Polish
- [ ] Write unit tests for grid generation
- [ ] Write unit tests for word validation
- [ ] Test complete game flow
- [ ] Update documentation"}
{"command":"gh repo create FindEmWords --public --description \u0022A fun word search puzzle game built with React\u0022 --clone","description":"Create GitHub repository for FindEmWords"}

messages.reasoningContent:
The user wants me to create a word search game called "FindEmWords" as a React web app. Let me break down the requirements:

1. 10x10 grid of letters
2. 5 words hidden in the grid
3. Words can be horizontal, vertical, diagonal, or any combination
4. Words can be backwards
5. No words can share the same letter position
6. Click and drag to select letters
7. On mouse up, check if a word was found
8. If found: animate congratulations, highlight word in grid, add to found words list
9. Don't show hidden words until guessed
10. When all 5 found: animated modal congratulations
11. Clicking the modal dismisses it and starts a new game
12. "Play Again" button to restart
13. After winning, grid stays but no more input accepted

Let me create this game following the development workflow outlined in my instructions.

I'll need to:
1. Create a GitHub repository
2. Set up the React project structure
3. Create the development plan
4. Implement the game
5. Write tests
6. Document everything

Let me start by creating the repository and project structure.

<exited with exit code 0>
